meanings.definition: More unsteady or shaky in structure or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The wonkier table wobbled as I placed my glass on it.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge looked even wonkier after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The wonkier chair seemed to have a mind of its own, tipping back unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her wonkier handwriting resembled a rollercoaster ride on paper.
meanings.sent5: The wonkier path through the forest was treacherous, with roots and rocks jutting out.

meanings.definition: More eccentric or peculiar in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The wonkier professor wore mismatched socks to class.
meanings.sent2: The artist's latest sculpture was even wonkier than his previous works.
meanings.sent3: The wonkier cat insisted on wearing a tiny top hat around the house.
meanings.sent4: Her wonkier ideas were like colorful balloons floating in a gray sky.
meanings.sent5: The wonkier house on the block had a garden filled with upside-down flowers.
